intro: Malapoenna reticulata, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and a distinctive net-like venation pattern. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded areas. Malapoenna reticulata is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
